metadata.Title: CVE-2021-22898 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.Description: curl 7.7 through 7.76.1 suffers from an information disclosure when the`-t` command line option, known as `CURLOPT_TELNETOPTIONS` in libcurl, isused to send variable=content pairs to TELNET servers. Due to a flaw in theoption parser for sending NEW_ENV variables, libcurl could be made to passon uninitialized data from a stack based buffer to the server, resulting inpotentially revealing sensitive internal information to the server using aclear-text network protocol.

criterions.comment: curl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
